ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I notice differences in the way my body reacts to various foods.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I can always tell when I bump myself whether or not it will become a bruise.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I always know when I've exerted myself to the point where I'll be sore the next day.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I am always aware of changes in my energy level when I eat certain foods.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I know in advance when I'm getting the flu.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I know I'm running a fever without taking my temperature.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I can distinguish between tiredness because of hunger and tiredness because of lack of sleep.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I can accurately predict what time of day lack of sleep will catch up with me.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I am aware of a cycle in my activity level throughout the day.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I DON'T notice seasonal rhythms and cycles in the way my body functions.
Notes: 7=Not at all true of me; 1=Very true of me

ElementDescription: As soon as I wake up in the morning, I know how much energy I'll have during the day.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I notice distinct body reactions when I am fatigued.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I notice specific body responses to changes in the weather.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I can predict how much sleep I will need at night in order to wake up refreshed.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: When my exercise habits change, I can predict very accurately how that will affect my energy level.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I notice specific bodily reactions to being overhungry.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: I can tell when I go to bed how well I will sleep that night.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: There seems to be a "best" time for me to go to sleep at night.
Notes: 1=Not at all true of me; 7=Very true of me

ElementDescription: Body Awareness Questionnaire: Note Response or Changes in Body Process Scale
Body Awareness Questionnaire: Predict Body Reaction Scale
Body Awareness Questionnaire: Sleep-Wake Cycle Scale
Body Awareness Questionnaire: Onset of Illness Scale
Body Awareness Questionnaire: Fitness Scale
Body Awareness Questionnaire: Body Patterns Scale
